evidence.text:
Person B: I'll answer them after I see my daughter and my husband. 
Person A: He's upstairs. He's already told us everything he knows. You just need to confirm.

Person B: Mrs. Paiva, all I'm trying to do is make sure you can keep taking care of your home, driving your kids to school and playing your backgammon. That's my job. 
Person A: Did you do something to my daughter?
Person B: Did she do anything wrong?
Person A: Of course not. What sort of a question is that?
Person B: Who is this man?
Person A: Rubens.
Person A: That's Martha, my daughters' teacher. What is she doing here?
Person B: Her son provides logistics for the subversives in Chile.
Person A: What does Rubens have to do with any of this?
Person B: Martha was intercepted at the airport yesterday, bringing letters for your husband. I want to know how he delivers them to the terrorists.
Person A: I told you, Rubens has nothing to do with terrorists.
Person A: Will I see my daughter now?

Person B: Have you seen my husband? They said he was upstairs. He's in a shirt and tie. He's got a mustache. 
Person B: His name is Rubens. Please, help me. I need to see him. Please.
